pageContext.claim: “Now, the United States -- depending on the way you calculate it -- was at 4.2 percent.  And I said, that's unfair.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. spent 3.5 percent of GDP on defense spending — not 4.2. Using 2018 predictions, if the U.S. were to up its defense spending to 4.2 percent of GDP, the defense budget would balloon to over $850 billion — over $150 billion more than is currently budgeted.
